text:
The Big Three CEO salaries last year:
Ford: $21M
Stellantis: $25M
GM: $29M

CEO pay compared to their average worker:
Ford: 281x more
Stellantis: 365x more
GM: 362x more

It’s exploitation.

Speaker McCarthy has played a dangerous game with the lives and livelihoods of our residents. He has consistently pushed an extremist agenda—yet he’s still not extreme enough for his own party. I voted for the motion to vacate to hold him accountable.

October is Filipino American History Month! As the third largest Asian American group in our country, Filipino Americans have made substantial contributions to our nation. This month, we uplift their culture, heritage, and lasting impact on our society.

After a handful of MAGA extremists held our country hostage and tried to force a government shutdown, we held the line against Republicans’ cruel cuts, and passed a clean bill to keep the government open and protect food assistance for mothers and babies in our communities.

In a matter of hours, the federal government will shut down.

207,000 mothers and children in Michigan could lose access to food assistance.

But Republicans don’t care because they’re going to continue to get paid.
A MAGA government shutdown has real consequences for the American people.

If you are a veteran who was deployed to a combat zone and left active duty between September 11, 2001, and October 1, 2013, you are eligible for VA health care under the PACT Act. The deadline for this open enrollment period is TOMORROW.

Sign up now at VA.gov/PACT

Student loan payments are set to restart on October 1, and 1 in 5 borrowers will struggle to make payments.

Republicans have no problem bailing out the rich, but when it comes to helping everyday Americans, they block student debt relief. It's disgraceful.

By moving forward with this decision, the U.S. government is allowing a foreign government to discriminate against its own citizens based on protected class.

My statement on the Biden Administration’s admission of Israel into the Visa Waiver Program:
tlaib.house.gov/posts/tlaib-…

We have two days to fund the government, but MAGA Republicans are deliberately forcing a government shutdown that will harm working families and their own federal employees. Here’s what you need to know.

I was proud to welcome the 12th Congressional District and many of our Michigan residents to D.C. for CBC week!

It was a pleasure to attend so many events to uplift our Black neighbors. Thank you all for your leadership and advocacy.

In honor of #HispanicHeritageMonth, we uplift the work of Art Reyes III, the founding Executive Director of “We the People” and a resident of our district. He’s a community organizer, leader in the Flint water crisis, and hails from three generations of proud UAW members.

Starting this week, you can order another round of free at-home COVID tests.
 
Visit COVIDTests.gov or call 1-800-232-0233 to order yours today.

The bribery and corruption charges against Senator Menendez are extremely serious. 

From the Supreme Court to the Senate, the American people deserve trust in their public institutions. Senator Menendez must resign.
Welcome to Michigan, @POTUS! #StandUpUAW
Solidarity with the thousands of @UAW workers at 38 Stellantis and GM distribution centers across 20 states going on strike.

Marsha Bruhn is a public servant and longtime resident of Detroit's Grandmont Rosedale community. As the Director of the Detroit Planning Commission, she has given over 22 years of service to strengthening housing and small businesses in our neighborhoods.

This is such an important step. No one should be punished because they got sick and could not afford medical care. Medical debt has no place on a credit report.
npr.org/sections/health-shot…

I’m so excited to announce that I will be back on the House Oversight and Accountability Committee. My residents sent me to Congress to fight for them and serving on this committee will give me the platform to make their voices heard.
tlaib.house.gov/posts/tlaib-…

Join me in recognizing David Hecker for his 22 years of public service as President of AFT Michigan and his commitment to improving the lives of teachers across our state. I am blessed to call him a friend and wish him well in his retirement.

John Lewis called the right to vote precious, almost sacred. We cannot allow extremists to undermine our democracy and silence our voices. We must pass the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.
Water is a human right. Period. @WeThePeopleDet

In 2022, a record breaking 110,000 people in the U.S. lost their lives to an overdose. This month is National Recovery Month. I’m wearing purple with my colleagues to advocate for folks getting the support and resources they need on their road to recovery.
In the midst of a powerful labor movement across our country, my congressional staff voted to unionize. Congratulations to my team! I am so proud of you.

Our communities are sick and tired of being sacrificed so that corporate CEOs and investors can make an extra buck.

The health and safety of our residents and rail workers is more important than their obscene profits. Let's pass the Rail Worker and Community Safety Act.

I'm proud to introduce the Restaurant Workers Bill of Rights.

Restaurant workers deserve thriving wages plus tips, universal health care, strong unions, paid leave, safe work environments and basic human dignity.

As Chair of the Congressional Mamas’ Caucus, I know how important childcare is for working families.

With federal childcare funding set to expire at the end of this month, 3.2 million children could be left without care.

We must pass emergency childcare funding.

This year, Jack and Jill of America’s Oakland County Chapter celebrates 45 years of service, education, and excellence in our community. Join me in recognizing their leadership and mentorship of young African American leaders across Oakland County.

The @UAW workers are the reason the Big Three are making record profits.

But the Big Three CEOs are now making 360x more than their average worker.

The @UAW is making history fighting corporate greed.

We are a nation of immigrants, and I’m proud to say that #12thDistrictStrong is a beautiful reflection of that diversity.

We must pass the American Dream and Promise Act.
Proud to join @SenSanders on strike with the @UAW in Detroit. Their fight for economic justice and human dignity is the fight of the entire working class.

I will be joining MSNBC in a moment for an interview on the UAW strike. Tune in!

Solidarity with the #UAW.

Today marks the beginning of #HispanicHeritageMonth! This month, we honor our Latino neighbors and celebrate their heritage and tremendous contributions to our community. Our strength as a nation lies in our diversity.

L’Shana Tova to our Jewish neighbors in #12thDistrictStrong and around the world! 

Wishing you and your loved ones a happy and healthy New Year.
Proud to join our workers on the picket line at the Ford Plant in Wayne last night when the @UAW when on strike at the Big Three.
Solidarity with the @UAW.

Right now, Georgia officials are attempting to criminalize the civil disobedience tactics of the civil rights movement, and pursing blatantly political charges against protesters.

Read my op-ed with @RepCori on the fight to #StopCopCity:
thenation.com/article/activi…
Today, @RepJayapal and I led 31 of our colleagues in a letter to @POTUS, urging him to phase out oil and gas production on federal lands and waters.

Big Oil and Gas are fighting for more profits, but we are fighting for our lives and the future of our planet. Proud to join so many incredible climate activists today at the Rally to End Fossil Fuels.

"President Biden has more power than anyone on Earth to confront the climate threat facing us all and signal to world leaders that the fossil fuel era is ending."

It's time to declare a climate emergency.

Read my op-ed with @ajeansu:
thehill.com/opinion/congress…

I was honored to speak at the opening of the new PACE Southeast Michigan Detroit Center. PACE provides holistic, comprehensive care for our seasoned residents in 12th District Strong. The clinic was named in honor of Dr. Graddy, a trailblazer in our community.

Every year, 350 children unintentionally shoot themselves or someone else.

I’m proud to sign the @HouseGVP discharge petition to force Republican leadership to vote on Ethan’s Law to keep kids safe from unsecured firearms by requiring safe storage.

Solidarity with the 150,000 @UAW members planning to strike for a fair contract.

In the first six months of this year, the Big Three: Ford, Stellantis and GM made a combined $20 billion in profits.

Record profits should mean record contracts.
Solidarity with the 1,100 @UAW members at Blue Cross Blue Shield Michigan on strike for a fair contract.
michiganradio.org/2023-09-12…

New data shows that child poverty more than doubled from 2021 to 2022. My End Child Poverty Act would create a Universal Child Benefit that would provide a monthly payment to families and ensure that every child can access the resources they need to live safe, healthy lives.

Since 2009, the federal minimum wage has been $7.25 an hour.
 
If the minimum wage kept up with inflation and productivity since 1968, it would be more than $23 today.
 
It’s time for Congress to raise the wage!

150,000 UAW members are fighting for a fair contract, and I’ve got their back. I grew up in a union household so I have seen the power of the UAW. It’s time for the Big Three to do what’s right. Record profits should result in record contracts.

It was a pleasure to join the @MichiganLCV and state & local officials for an Inflation Reduction Act roundtable on climate action. We discussed how we can use federal funds for energy efficiency and clean energy in our communities.

22 years since September 11th, we remember the victims and families impacted by this horrific tragedy, and the countless lives lost in the flawed “War on Terror.”

May we honor their lives by pushing for a more peaceful world every day.

I had the pleasure of honoring 25 outstanding veterans who work at the Detroit VA and go above and beyond in their service. I will continue to fight to ensure that our veterans are given the proper treatment and resources when they return home.

3.2 million children could lose childcare soon, including over 56,000 in Michigan, because federal funding is set to expire at the end of the month.

I hosted a roundtable with the Mamas’ Caucus and leaders in our community to discuss the urgent need for childcare investments.

We can’t let greedy CEOs continue to exploit workers.
 
Record profits should mean record wages.
Joined @RepDebDingell in standing with our UAW workers at the Trenton Engine Plant. Workers deserve a commitment that Stellantis will keep the plant open.

Curious about the air quality in your community? There's a new app from the EPA called AirNow that makes it easy to check current and forecast air quality information to plan daily activities and protect your health. Download it here:
airnow.gov/airnow-mobile-app…

A proud union member reminded me during the Labor Day march down Michigan Ave that the labor movement fought hard for weekends and days of rest.

As we hear about successful labor organizing and big wins for Teamsters and others, let’s make sure we show solidarity with action.

I'm proud to lead our colleagues in pushing for justice for the victims & survivors of the Bhopal chemical disaster. Those responsible must face their day in court—the 500,000+ people poisoned by their recklessness deserve nothing less.

Decades ago, poor maintenance & safety failures at a Union Carbide (now DOW Chemical) plant in Bhopal, India caused a massive leak of poisonous gas killing over 7,000 people and harming countless others. The DOJ must help India get justice for the victims from this U.S. company.
Abortion care is health care and a fundamental human right.

According to the CDC, suicide rates reached a record high last year. This Suicide Prevention Awareness Month, check in on your friends and loved ones.

Call or text 988 to reach the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline for free, confidential help 24/7.

Happy Labor Day! Today we celebrate solidarity and collective action in the labor movement. 

As workers across our district fight for livable wages and better working conditions, I am committed to protecting the right to organize and raising the federal minimum wage.

Attention veterans: Until September 30 veterans who deployed to a combat zone, never enrolled in VA health care, and left active duty between September 11, 2001 and October 1, 2013 are eligible to enroll directly in VA health care. Apply now at VA.gov/PACT
It was great to meet with President Espy, the new president of my alma mater, Wayne State. I'm looking forward to working together to improve the lives of our neighbors and our Warrior community.

I had a productive tour at Trinity Health Livonia Hospital where we discussed the urgent need to expand access to affordable and quality health care in our communities. 

Health care is a human right, and we must work together to ensure all of our neighbors have quality care.

For far too long, corporations have prioritized profits over human dignity.

It’s time for a 32-hour work week.

It was great to join the SBA Black Business Month Celebration with District Director Laketa Henderson! Black-owned small businesses are the backbone of our district and we must uplift and support them as they continue to thrive.

I was happy to join local officials in celebrating the groundbreaking for road renovations at Eliza Howell Park. Eliza Howell Park is Detroit's third largest park and important to our residents in #12thDistrictStrong.

59 years ago today, the Food Stamp Act was signed into law.

We must continue fighting back against Republican efforts to cut vital programs to address hunger like SNAP for millions of Americans.

I attended an NAACP Community Event, bringing together leaders and activists in our communities to speak about our shared commitment to justice. I am so proud of all the local leaders who are committed to advancing civil rights, social justice, and community empowerment.

Big Pharma continues to make record profits while price-gouging the American people. There is no reason why Americans should pay the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs.

This is an important step in taking on corporate greed.

Amid a rise in violence against the LGBTQ+ community, we must continue to speak out and protect our LGBTQ+ neighbors.

Every American deserves to live free from discrimination. It’s time for Congress to send the Equality Act to the President’s desk.
He should spend more time protecting Black lives instead of erasing Black history.

As we have seen with the recent flooding in Southeast Michigan, the climate crisis is here. 
 
We must invest in climate resilient infrastructure, and transition to clean energy to address this crisis.

60 years ago, at the March on Washington, Dr. King spoke of the need to remind America of the fierce urgency of now.

Today, may we move with that same urgency as we continue the march towards economic and racial justice for Black Americans.

No matter your zip code, you deserve access to abortion care.
 
We must get the Women’s Health Protection Act signed into law and restore abortion access nationwide.

White supremacy is a deadly disease in our country. We must root it out and pass legislation to protect our communities from gun violence.  

Our communities deserve more than condolences. Our Black neighbors deserve to live without fear for their lives.
I am furious and heartbroken about the racially motivated shooting in Jacksonville and sending love to the community and the victims’ loved ones.
Always proud to join @UAW members in solidarity. ✊🏽
Due to the power outages and record temperatures, here are a list of cooling centers throughout #12thDistrictStrong. Stay safe and know that my door is always open to you and your family.

We cannot ignore the facts, climate change is here. This summer, deadly heatwaves have swept our nation, endangering millions struggling with unaffordable utility bills. My colleagues and I wrote to Speaker McCarthy and Leader Jeffries urging immediate action to keep people safe.
If you and your family have experienced discrimination upon entry into Israel from the United States, it's important to know how to report it. Below please find resources:

Two years ago, the House passed the historic John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. We must honor the legacy of John Lewis by getting this legislation signed into law and protect the voting rights of everyone in this country.

I was honored to attend the Dearborn Peace Park Groundbreaking ceremony, marking the beginning of a transformative journey to create a community space for our residents to foster connections and enjoy time outdoors.

At least 85% of Americans have recently experienced a hidden or unexpected fee.

We need to pass legislation to crack down on corporate greed that raises costs for working families—from surprise medical bills to junk fees.

Congratulations to the more than 340,000 UPS @Teamsters on this historic contract!

You have demonstrated the power of solidarity and collective action in the fight for livable wages and better working conditions for workers across our country.

Proud to sign this amicus brief with the Gun Violence Prevention Task Force.

We need to protect survivors and get firearms out of the hands of domestic violence abusers.

Our urban agriculture leaders in #12thDistrictStrong are essential in providing healthy food for our communities. It was great to meet with them and @SenStabenow to discuss how our next Farm Bill can support urban farmers.

Our young people give me hope as they fight for our future. I'm celebrating Judge Seeley's historic ruling in favor of 16 Montana youths that their state's laws ignoring climate risks are unconstitutional. Now DOJ should stop obstructing the Juliana youth case in federal court!

Lake Guardian is the largest research vessel in the U.S. EPA fleet and the largest research vessel operating on our Great Lakes. This past week, we toured the vessel to learn about monitoring and reports on trends of the Great Lakes ecosystem and efforts to protect our water.

Moms make just 62 cents for every dollar dads make. We often face bias, career interruptions and lower pay after having a child – that’s the “motherhood penalty,” That’s why I founded the Mamas' Caucus to fight for our mothers, equal pay and so much more. #MomsEqualPayDay
88 years ago, #SocialSecurity became law. I will continue to fight to enhance and protect our most vulnerable community members benefits.
Firearms are the leading cause of death for children in America and Speaker McCarthy hasn’t brought a single gun violence prevention bill to the floor for a vote this Congress.
Making sure no one dies from not being able to afford health care should not be considered a “radical” idea.

I introduced the End Child Poverty Act to create a universal child assistance program in our country.

Congress somehow always finds money to invest in weapons and forever wars but can't find the funding to ensure that no child goes hungry.

We must do more to save our planet and protect our frontline residents from corporate polluters, and we are not moving with the urgency that this moment demands.

I was proud to join @CleanAirMoms to call for action at every level of government to deliver environmental justice.

On August 6th and 9th in 1945, the United States dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki killing hundreds of thousands of innocent civilians.

Today, we recommit ourselves to calling for the abolition of nuclear weapons.

Please note: Due to high volume, some veterans are receiving error messages when submitting their intent to file PACT Act claims. If you received one of these messages, don’t worry! Your intent to file has been logged and your effective date for benefits has been saved.

Veterans, if you were exposed to toxic substances during your service, you may be eligible for benefits under the PACT Act. You must apply by TODAY, August 9 to ensure your new benefits are backdated to last year. Learn more at: VA.gov/PACT

I loved being part of the grand opening ceremony of this year’s Dearborn Homecoming. It is the first time in years that the event is back at it’s original location which made so many of our residents incredibly happy.

The PACT Act was the largest expansion of veterans’ benefits in decades, impacting approximately one out of every five veterans.

I was proud to join @RepDebDingell to raise awareness about the health care and benefits for countless veterans harmed by toxic exposure.

Read more about the bill here👇🏽
tlaib.house.gov/posts/tlaib-…

I'm introducing the Restoring Unfairly Impaired Credit & Protecting Consumers Act to provide credit restoration for victims of predatory lending and fraud, prohibit the reporting of medical debt, and reduce the length of time that adverse information appears on credit reports.
Read more about it here: detroitnews.com/story/news/l…

Surprise medical bills and junk fees impose a significant financial burden on working families. I was proud to partner with @RepDebDingell during National Health Center Week to discuss our work to crack down on surprise medical billing and hidden costs for our residents.

Facial recognition technology discriminates against Black and brown people. This is yet another horrific story about an innocent Black Detroiter falsely arrested. We must pass the Facial Recognition and Biometric Technology Moratorium Act to ban the use of this racist technology.

On this day in 1965, the Voting Rights Act was signed into law, a monumental step to end racially discriminatory practices in voting.

Amid Republican attacks, I will continue the fight against voter suppression and racial discrimination at the ballot box.
In Michigan, one in nine people face hunger. In our district, 22% of families receive SNAP benefits. We must protect and expand programs to address hunger like TEFAP, SNAP, WIC, not cut them.

Proud to meet with STEP (Services to Enhance Potential) in Westland to learn about how they help our neighbors with disabilities pursue their dreams by providing career training and supportive resources.

The air monitors in Wayne County will make clear the cumulative impacts of pollution that our residents are breathing, but we must urgently turn that data into life-changing interventions. Our neighbors can’t wait any more. We all have a right to breathe clean air.
Thank you Triumph Church for inviting me to celebrate the 50th birthday of Reverend Kinloch, in #12thDistrictStrong. Happy Birthday and thank you for your service to our community!

What Abbott is doing at the border is barbaric. This is a grave violation of human rights. Migrants deserve to be treated with human dignity.
abcnews.go.com/amp/Internati…

Amazon workers have been underpaid, and subject to short staffing, union-busting, and hostile work environments. I was proud to join the DTW 1 Amazon Organizing Committee to discuss these issues. I remain committed to standing up for workers and taking on corporate greed.

We must do all we can to protect people from sexual abuse. I will continue to fight back against sexual harassment and work to protect our vulnerable populations from human trafficking. I was grateful to speak at the Coalition of Black Trade Unionists’ Human Trafficking Summit.

We must never forget how fragile our democracy is and how important it is that we protect it.

Donald Trump must be held accountable for conspiring to overturn an election and inciting a violent, fascist insurrection.

The American people deserve justice.
We need universal school meals for every child in America.

It's outrageous that in Florida, public school students will now be taught that enslaved Black folks benefited from slavery.

Slavery was evil, disgusting and had no redeeming qualities. Period.

On this day in 1965, Medicare and Medicaid were signed into law, which have provided essential care and saved countless American lives over the last 58 years. I remain committed to fighting to protect these critical programs, despite Republican efforts to end them.

Southeast Michigan is home to the largest concentration of veterans in the Midwest, and many of our veterans face homelessness. The House passed my amendment to the VA appropriations bill, which increases the funding for a veteran state home construction grant by $5 million.

Today is the one-year anniversary of the Congressional Mamas’ Caucus, which I founded to advocate for mothers of color and working families.

Whether it's Black maternal health, reproductive justice or paid leave, mothers must have a seat at the table where policies are made.

It was great to join the @GND_Network to speak about how the movement for the Green New Deal and environmental justice must be rooted in solidarity with the labor movement.

Thank you to all the activists and organizers fighting for our future.

Happy #NationalInternDay! This summer, we had the privilege of welcoming interns from Michigan, and one from Palestine. Our interns are incredibly hardworking and motivated to create change, and I am so excited to see what their bright futures hold.
Abolish solitary confinement.

Ms. Joyce Hamlett has worked in the Capitol for over 35 years and will be sorely missed as she retires as Keeper of the Mace and Assistant Sergeant at Arms. She made history as the first Black woman to hold the post. Thank you for your service.
We only have two months to stop a government shutdown and @SpeakerMcCarthy is cancelling votes and sending everyone home early.

Black women continue to face a wage gap of 67 cents compared to white men for full-time, year-round work.

Today, on #BlackWomensEqualPayDay, we demand that Black women be paid what they're owed. Black women deserve equal pay for equal work.

Solitary confinement is torture. The average size of a confinement cell is 70 sq ft, smaller than a parking space. The devastating toll on mental health, risk of self harm, and trauma is inhumane.

Proud to join @RepCori in introducing the End Solitary Confinement Act.

This is a prime example of how corporate polluters treat fines for violations as the cost of doing business. My Cumulative Impacts Act would overhaul our permitting system to deny permits for corporate polluters who poison our neighborhoods and harm our health. We deserve better.

Last year @Stellantis paid a $137K fine as punishment for illegally spewing pollution into Black neighborhoods. For each new violation they pay just $5K in fines. These amounts are meaningless to a company making $12B in 6 months, but the pollution harms our communities forever.

AT&T has announced closures of call centers across the Midwest including our sales office in Southfield. They must stop shutting down centers and sending those jobs overseas.

Solidarity with @D4Cwa in their fight against corporate greed.
Our residents are struggling while economic inequality is reaching record highs. It’s time to #TaxTheRich and get big money out of politics.

Mass incarceration and criminalization don't keep our communities safe. Real public safety means investing in our schools, affordable housing, access to health care, and basic necessities.

Proud to support @RepCori's #PeoplesResponseAct to change our approach to public safety.

No one should worry about how they’re going to pay rent or make ends meet because they can’t rely on consistent pay and lack the benefits they need. I introduced the Restaurant Workers Bill of Rights to provide essential protections for every restaurant worker in the country.

Congratulations, @Teamsters!

This is an incredible victory in the fight for working people across our country. There’s power in solidarity. At a time of massive income and wealth inequality, solidarity is key in taking on corporate greed and delivering for the working class.

Happy Disability Pride Month!

People with disabilities deserve to be celebrated and centered in policies in Congress—from equal rights, to accessible infrastructure, to reproductive freedom. I will continue to fight to empower and celebrate our neighbors with disabilities.

I was proud to host a briefing for my colleagues and our staff on enhancing Constituent Services in Congress. We talked about making direct contact with our residents, hosting district events like Constituent Service Fairs and Open Houses, print communications, and outreach.

Where pollution occurs is a policy choice. It’s environmental racism.

I introduced the Cumulative Impacts Act to require the EPA to consider the cumulative impacts of pollution in permitting decisions and how they affect the public health of our frontline communities.

It’s been 100 years since the Equal Rights Amendment was introduced, and we’re still fighting for equal rights. Every American, regardless of their gender identity or sexual orientation, deserves full constitutional equality. It’s time to ratify the ERA.

Want to intern in my office? Our Fall 2023 internship applications are now open and due tomorrow, July 21! Apply now👇🏽
tlaib.house.gov/internships

Syrian Dictator Bashar al-Assad is a war criminal.

I introduced the Justice for Syrians resolution with Rep. @Ilhan to hold Assad accountable for crimes against humanity.

It’s time for the Syrian people to have justice.
tlaib.house.gov/posts/tlaib-…

205 House Democrats have signed a discharge petition to bring the Assault Weapons Ban to the floor for a vote.

How many more children will have to die in mass shootings before Republicans finally join us?

We urge all Members of Congress who stand for human rights for all to join us in boycotting apartheid.

Our joint statement with @RepCori:
tlaib.house.gov/posts/tlaib-…

Israel is an apartheid state.

Let’s take a moment just to hear the Israeli government’s own politicians in their own words, not mine.

Join me in honoring Mother Patricia “Pat” Braxton, a legacy in our community, as she celebrates 75 years of life. Her passion for our community shines through in everything she does. She is a mentor for many women of color in public office.

In solidarity with the Palestinian people and all those who have been harmed by Israel's apartheid government, I will be boycotting President Herzog’s joint address to Congress.

I urge all Members of Congress who stand for human rights for all to join me. #BoycottApartheid

Today is #HIVPreventionDay. We cannot end the HIV epidemic without ensuring PrEP equity.

Congress must guarantee equitable access to this proven and effective HIV prevention medication.

The Israeli government is committing the crime of apartheid according to the @UN, @HRW, @Amnesty International, & @BTselem (the largest human rights organization in Israel). Apartheid is a racist system of oppression.

Weapons of war have no place in our communities. It’s that simple.
 
Ban assault weapons.
Read more about the amendment here: tlaib.house.gov/posts/tlaib-…

I could not vote to pass another record-breaking $886 billion Pentagon budget with extreme provisions that gut abortion access, target trans servicemembers, and fuel climate change, but I'm grateful my colleagues supported my amendment to raise awareness about suicide prevention.

Congratulations to the Heroes’ Alliance Vehicle Technology Team from Metro Detroit for competing in the Solar Car Challenge. This incredible group of students will race their solar vehicle across the country this summer. #12thDistrictStrong is rooting for you!
I want to give a special thank you to the incredible veterans at @CommonDefense for collaborating on this amendment to maximize its effectiveness.

The forever wars of the past decades have left behind immense trauma.

My amendment to the NDAA ensures that information about the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline is posted in visible locations to raise awareness about this life-saving resource for servicemembers and veterans.

This Park and Recreation month and every month, we all deserve access to our natural resources, especially our frontline communities.

I introduced the Environmental Justice in Recreation Permitting Act to expand access to our public lands and waters.

We have the right to breathe clean air. Read more about the bill here 👇🏽
tlaib.house.gov/posts/tlaib-…

If these past two months taught us anything, it’s that we need stronger protections against air pollution. I'm introducing the Cumulative Impacts Act to require the EPA to consider the cumulative impacts of pollution in permitting decisions and how they impact our public health.
Republicans want to gut vital programs to address hunger to put more money into the pockets of the 1%. Working families deserve better.

Since 2014 @BankofAmerica has been fined over a billion dollars for violating consumer protections.

That's less than 5% of their annual net revenue, and we wonder why their behavior doesn't change?

A $150 million fine is a slap on the wrist.

We need public banking now.
Mother JoAnn was dedicated to empowering our communities and relentlessly fought for justice for our Black neighbors. She was an inspiration to myself and many others. May she rest in power.

My condolences for the passing of Mother JoAnn Watson, also known as The Honorable Rev. JoAnn Watson. Mother JoAnn was a pillar in the Detroit community, serving as a Detroit City Council Member and the first woman to serve as the Executive Director of the Detroit NAACP.

Cluster bombs that the U.S. dropped on Vietnam are still killing civilians to this day. Nearly 125 countries have banned their use—we should not be sending them to Ukraine.

The U.S. needs to join the international community in banning their use and destroy our stockpile.

I was proud to join @SecBecerra in Detroit for a roundtable on the need to protect access to reproductive health care.

I will continue to fight like hell to restore every American’s right to reproductive freedom and ensure Congress codifies abortion rights into federal law.

155 years ago today, the 14th Amendment was ratified, establishing citizenship and equal protection under law for formerly enslaved Black Americans.

Yet, 155 years later, we are still fighting for Black liberation. Congress must provide reparations.

I was honored to speak with some phenomenal young women at “Girls Making Change," a high school fellowship that empowers young women of color to lead through social justice advocacy and community action. This is our next generation of leaders!

I was thrilled to spend time with our seniors at Hartford Village. We discussed rising auto insurance and utility rates, protecting Social Security and Medicare, and the need to pass the PAID Act. Our seniors deserve adequate resources to meet their basic needs and thrive.

Unchecked corporate greed impacts our most vulnerable communities the most. We must bring down costs and ensure that working families are paid the livable wages they deserve. 

It’s time for Congress to raise the federal minimum wage.

Michigan will soon become one of a handful of states to provide free school meals for every child.

It’s time for Congress to pass the Universal School Meals Program Act and make sure no child goes hungry at school in every state across the nation.

It’s disgraceful that last year, three major insulin manufacturers made billions of dollars in profits while 1.3 million people with diabetes were forced to ration their insulin. 
We need to pass @RepCori’s Insulin for All Act.

This is immoral. 

Medical debt should not exist.

Thank you to our #12thDistrictStrong seniors who joined us for our Senior Services Resource Fair. My team and I are always here to address your needs and provide you with the resources you need to thrive! For information about our senior services call my office at (313) 463-6220.
Everyone deserves to have access to health care and should not have to choose between medical treatment and putting food on the table. We need #MedicareForAll.
The Civil Rights Act was signed into law 59 years ago today. As we celebrate the progress we have made, we must also recognize the work that remains to achieve a truly equitable country for all.

My team and I hosted an Open House at our Neighborhood Service Center in Southfield, where residents stopped by to ask questions, speak with our team, and check out our new office. As your Congresswoman, know that my door is always open to you. See you at our next event!
